page_analysis.text_content:
Below-grade patios standards
& site planning

• Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard.

• Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater and no single area may exceed 200 sf. Note area devoted to required stairway egress shall not be included in the 200 sf limitation.

• Each such area is separated from another by at least 10'.

• Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 2' max.

• Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'.

• The combined length of all the excavated features or portions of features that encroach into the required yards, on all sides of the structure, may not exceed 15'.

• Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees.

• Public Works Department must approve drainage system.

• Overhangs or canopies installed to shelter such area shall count towards lot coverage.

• Such areas to be architecturally compatible with residence.

• Such areas to be screened to off site views by means of landscaping and/or fencing as determined appropriate by Planning Dept.

Fig 40 Examples of site plan w/below-grade patios

Key
— Curb
- - - Lot line
▭▭▭ Sidewalk
- - - - Required setbacks
▭▭▭▭ Buildable area
▭▭▭▭ Dwelling
■ Lightwells & stairwells
□ Lightwells & stairwells that encroach into the required yards
🌳 Landscaping screening

Below-grade patios
• a + b (encroaching features) may not exceed 15'
• No single below-grade patio may not exceed 200 sf
• Combined areas of all below-grade patio areas may not exceed 2% of the lot area or 200 sf, which ever is greater

Note: measurements are based on interior dimension of opening and exclude encasing structure.

visual_elements.description: Fig 40 is a site plan example illustrating below-grade patios. It shows a lot with a main dwelling and a 2nd dwelling. The plan marks the front yard, rear yard, and interior side yards. It highlights areas of encroachment into required yards with labels for 'length of encroachment' and 'max encroachment' values. The plan shows a 10' minimum separation between below-grade patios. Landscaping screening is indicated with tree icons. The key explains symbols for curb, lot line, sidewalk, required setbacks, buildable area, dwelling, lightwells & stairwells, lightwells & stairwells that encroach into required yards, and landscaping screening.
visual_elements.location: Right side, occupying majority of the page height

technical_specifications.parameter: Combined area of all below-grade patio areas
Minimum separation between below-grade patio areas
Allowable encroachment into required side yard
Allowable encroachment into required rear yard
Combined length of all excavated features encroaching into required yards

additional_notes: Page number 43 at bottom right corner.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Layout: Left side contains bulleted zoning and planning rules; right side contains figure with key and summary bullet points below figure.

qualifiers.text: Note area devoted to required stairway egress shall not be included in the 200 sf limitation.

conditions.text: Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard.
conditions.threshold_value: located on side facing front yard

conditions.text: Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater and no single area may exceed 200 sf.
conditions.threshold_value: 2% of lot area or 200 sf (whichever is greater)

conditions.text: Each such area is separated from another by at least 10'.
Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 2' max.
Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'.
The combined length of all the excavated features or portions of features that encroach into the required yards, on all sides of the structure, may not exceed 15'.
Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees.
Public Works Department must approve drainage system.
Overhangs or canopies installed to shelter such area shall count towards lot coverage.
Such areas to be architecturally compatible with residence.
Such areas to be screened to off site views by means of landscaping and/or fencing as determined appropriate by Planning Dept.

logical_relationships.expression: Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater AND each such area separated by at least 10' AND allowable encroachment into side yard is 2' max AND allowable encroachment into rear yard is 4' AND combined length of all encroachments may not exceed 15'.

execution_sequence.action: Verify location of below-grade patios is not on side facing front yard.
Check combined area and single area limits for below-grade patios, excluding stairway egress area.
Ensure minimum separation of 10' between such areas.
Confirm allowable encroachments into side and rear yards are not exceeded.
Verify combined length of all encroachments into required yards does not exceed 15'.
Confirm excavated features are not harmful to neighboring trees.
Obtain Public Works Department approval for drainage system.
Include overhangs or canopies in lot coverage calculations.
Screen areas from off-site views by landscaping and/or fencing as determined by Planning Dept.
